website_summaries.verdict: Though it's not suitable for mild weather and tends to feel somewhat bulky, it's a handsome, well-made jacket that's made for frigid temperatures.
pros: Ideal for anyone who spends a lot of time outdoors
Effective in extremely cold, wet temperatures
Has a chin guard and is insulated with responsibly-sourced down
cons: This jacket is pricey and heavy, but if you need one that provides extreme warmth you may not mind

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me warm at minus 15 Fahrenheit
customer_reviews.text: Friends: This is the second one of these that I have purchased..... I managed to get RTV blue gasket maker all over the first one which reduced it to a work coat to wear on our Ranch in the remote Sangre de Cristo mountain range of Colorado. At 6'3" tall and 285 pounds the 3XL is the right size for me...... Google my name to Learn more...... Arthur Gerard Michael Baron von Boennighausen
customer_reviews.author: Arthur von Boennighausen

customer_reviews.title: Finest I ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the finest coat I have ever purchased and it totally stops any wind as advertised. I walk my dog in the morning and a couple times during the day. The temp was -18 on my thermometer and I wore this coat for the first time. I normally wear a hoodie sweatshirt and a zip up hoodie over it then a coat. That was a mistake.... The North Face Coat was more then advertised and I was hot with the sweatshirts on underneath it. I had to literally unzip the coat and take the hood off. I still broke a sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Runnels

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking jacket.  Very warm, but not bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I used The North Face’s sizing guide where you input your dimensions and it fits perfectly. This jacket is very nice looking and not bulky. The fur around the hood is removable and I prefer it without. The jacket is machine washable, but the fur is not. Jacket is very warm. I am happy with my purchase. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Best Coat
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is amazing. My wife purchased it for me and now these Chicago winters got nothin on me! I pitched the fur hood piece though....not my style.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Wenzel

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best cold weather coat ever made.
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best cold weather coat ever made. it is constructed magnificently, and it shrugs off frigid cold like it is a gnat and has a great look as well. Just one caution. This is a cold weather garment developed for cold weather outside activity. You can wear it from the train to your apartment or outside to do a few laps around the pond. Deep into the woods exploring or even climbing. But it isn't going to do you much good if you want to leave it on indoors, because you will soon perspire vigorously.
customer_reviews.author: Duane R.

customer_reviews.title: Very warm, wish the pocket situation was better
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is comfortable and warm and has performed admirably during single digit Chicago temperatures. I wouldn't call the jacket breathable, it gets pretty toasty after wearing it and walking around for a while. I do wish the outer front hand pockets were a bit larger and more easily accessible. The button/flap design makes it cumbersome to easily slide your thick gloved/mittened hands in and out. They're also not terribly big/deep so I really have to shove my earmuffs and gloves in when taking it off.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: The North Face Men's Gotham Jacket III
customer_reviews.text: jacket came as described , although the packing was horrible for a garment in this size, it came in a small box that can only fit a glove! its not your extreme winter jacket , but sufficient padding for harsh winters , although the hood not padded at all , yes you can take the fur off with couple of clips , size came perfect for me , I'm an M size , and that's a regular fit that's my first north face product
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed  El Morr

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I received a custom made Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I am long slender and getting anything to fit is a problem. It is either be disappointed and live with it, or alter it. This jacket is almost tailored for ME. Just lucky, I know. I do have an Eddie Bauer Expedition Jacket, so I do fully realize that this NF jacket is not going to be used to climb the Everest summit. It is my below freezing jacket. My EB Expedition is for the rare below zero. If I were to knit pick, more and bigger pockets, better lining in the pockets, and a more fully adjustable hood.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveMyDog

customer_reviews.title: Great Men’s winter coat.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is always freezing. He’s a very thin man. The Medium fit perfectly! He loves it,,says it’s super comfortable to drive in too. He’s always wearing black or navy blue coats, so I took a chance with the red. He looks really nice in that color. His favorite part? The knit band on the bottom so cold wind can’t blow up it. LOL! He insisted on removing the fur trim. My daughter have North Face Gothem jackets, hers gray, mine a mulberry. We are officially a North Face family!
customer_reviews.author: M. Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected, overrated jacket
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality flap, cold air easily get through front zipper. Very thin insulation at shoulder, constantly get cold shoulder. Like its waterproof shell, stylish and multiple pockets. Its not warmer nor comfortable than my 12 years old $50 London Fog jacket and 6 years old $200 waterproof Spyder Down Jacket. Overrated jacket, I'm returning it for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Warm, good fit, just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived today and was instantly put to use. It has been in the single digits here and I needed a jacket to replace my trusted field jacket. I can't say enough how wonderfully this jacket performed. It was a perfect fit (XXL - 5'11" 275 lbs) and was so warm, I actually had to turn the heat off in the car on the way home from the store!
customer_reviews.author: Scott T. Self

customer_reviews.title: VERY WARM COAT
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50” chest and a 42” Waist. I Bought a XL Size and fit Perfect. I Bought Urban Blue Color and Love it. Usually by a Black Color. High Quality Material used in making this Jacket. Perfect Waist Length for Sitting in your Car or SUV. Even bending over to pick something up. Has Zipper inside Pocket and Four Outside Pockets with Buttons. Nice Hood and built in Mouth Cover. Hood comes off. Nice Zipper with Draw Pull. Waterproof Material. 550 Down Insulation. Nice Elastic at waist and end of sleeve to keep out the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Silecchio

customer_reviews.title: Get a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Normally I wear an xxl with the layers of clothing I wear underneath my jackets bought the xxl and had to return it for the xl
customer_reviews.author: jason alfred

customer_reviews.title: Nice value-to-price ratio!
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat basic, but gets the job done. Very warm and durable, and sheds rain well. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: DCT

customer_reviews.title: Not the same color as shown in the pics. Much darker green in person.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this jacket. I have had my eyes on it for awhile now. When I finally pulled the trigger, it wasn't at all what was shown in the pics or what I expected. Online, it shows the jacket as more of a tan color. In person, it is a dark green. Very misleading. I would have loved to keep the jacket, as it fit well and was a nice look, but a very off putting color in m opinion.
customer_reviews.author: JDC732

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably warm.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent, incredibly warm jacket that is well worth the money. I tried both this and the McMurdo III. This was the clear winner. Pros: The warmth, the number of pockets, the built in gaiter, the removable faux fir on the hood, sleeves that both go into and cover the end of your gloves. Incredible bargain when on sale. Cons: The lack of a completely removable hood. The McMurdo III has this, so it's puzzling why it wasn't done on the Gotham III. Also seems to run a bit big.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Winter Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. Keeps me very warm in below 30 degree weather here in the NYC area. its lightweight but super warm. I love that the fur can be removed from the hoodie since im not a big fan of fur. I also love that inside the hood it has an attached mouth and nose mask you can just pull over your face for very frigid weather- this was a surprise to me but an excellent option. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Synn69

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for a trip to the Dakotas. It is a jacket, not a parka. Perhaps I expected too much. It is ok, noticed at sub-zero temps the outer shell, or maybe the next layer under it became brittle feeling. Kept me from, freezing, but certainly is not the warmest I've had. The hood with the faux fur could use some changes or a cinch, the upper part falls down in my face.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Its easy to pack and warm
customer_reviews.text: 25 years ago I bought a jacket like this from a well known retailer. It has stood the test of time but I'm eventually going to need a replacement. I fish in Alaska and Canada and this jacket keeps me warm. It doesn't take up a lot of space in the luggage because of the down filing. AND, I don't look like the man made of tires when I'm wearing it. Can't say the name of the tires. Excellent jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. James D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT Jacket!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I can find nothing I dislike about this jacket. I ordered it in a large hoping it would be roomy enough to layer and it's Just right. I am 5'9" and 175 lbs and I can easily put a Hoodie under the jacket and it would then fit perfectly. The Hood is adjustable and very roomy so it would easily fit over a 2nd hood. Also, contrary to another reviewers comments, it does in fact have an inside zippered pocket! It's very warm and lightweight and easily handles 20 degrees before having to layer. All an all ... for 200 Bucks I would give it 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
customer_reviews.text: The North Face Gotham Jackets are some of the best winter coats made. But as for this particle jacket, I personally prefer the Gotham II over the Gotham III. The color is richer and the overall design is better. Still the same quality coat, but the previous style was better.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great cold weather jacket
customer_reviews.text: Found my self surprised by a cold snap while visiting in Chicago. Ordered this jacket second day and was ready when the single digits hit. It is great in wind and I do not feel the cold even in sub zero wind chills. Size was accurate. I don't need a lot of layers under this coat to stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for Antarctica
customer_reviews.text: I wore this in Antarctica. It was summer there, though, and this jacket was probably a little too warm. Nevertheless, I remained quite comfortable. The built-in face mask and the fur were extremely welcome in the freezing wind. The jacket was easy to don and doff in the cramped quarters of a commercial plane. It packs nicely along with the rest of your winter outfit in a small duffel.
customer_reviews.author: C J Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Feel, warmth, style and North Face quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel of this jacket as well as the style. Bought last year at the end of the season and only got to wear it twice so I'm really looking forward to this season. I've got other down coats and jackets from lite weight compressible to heavy weight parkas and Thermo-balls but I think that this will be my go to jacket this season. Am looking forward to the drop in temp.
customer_reviews.author: Biking Bri & my pal Milo

customer_reviews.title: Order a size smaller for a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Normally I wear an XL for coats so I figured a North Face shouldn't be any different. The XL in this is comically large on me for some reason. I prefer slimmer fit for most of my jackets. This jacket in XL was just too baggy and too big for my tastes. I love NF jackets however this one seems to have fallen a bit short. Great jacket otherwise and pretty warm. Size was just way off for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: LouRevue

customer_reviews.title: Rather buy the McMurdo parka 3. Sooo much better
customer_reviews.text: This jacket sizing is completely off. The style and practicality of this jacket is disturbing. I am 200 pounds and 6"1 and the large was excessively big. I returned it and bought the north face McMurdo parka in a size medium and could not be happier! The style and function of the McMurdo hands down beats the Gotham jacket. Don't waste your time with the Gotham just buy the McMurdo
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket on line and didn't know what to expect. The jacket is a little larger than I thought it would be, but it's a well made jacket and quite warm. I bought a XXL, but could have gotten away with XL.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: Love tnf products!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6 and on the bulky side. This jacket fits really well and I'm glad I went with a medium versus a small. The cuffs of the sleeves go just over my wrists enough to where there's enough room for my gloves, plus the coat it's self has an elastic wrist that keeps the cold wind from coming in. I wore it in sub zero temperatures this week with just a long sleeve shirt underneath and it kept me more than warm. A bit pricey, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Overall, about what I had expected
customer_reviews.text: I like this jacket, it looks nice, feels warm and at 6'1" and 260 lbs, the XXXL fits nicely for me. I feel the roughly $200 for this jacket, is about the right price point and I would recommend this to a friend, who needed a nice winter jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this jacket so far! Fits great and it's ridiculously warm! I'll update my review after this winter to see how it holds up. Amazon delivered this awesome jacket for less than half of what it normally costs! Thank you Amazon.;)
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Native

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and warm
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jacket and great quality, I ordered the TNF Black Matte Shine because I want the logo white. The logo is more like silver reflective. The jacket is really warm and waterproof, it also, has the sleeve that you can use to cover half of your face really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tak

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad investment!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is by far the most comfortable and warmest jacket I own. It beats out Marmot and Mountain Hardware jackets that cost triple the amount of money. I gave it a 4 and not a 5 only because the sizing is not not accurate. If you’re a LARGE, size down to a MEDIUM.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Warm Coat with Good Quality,

Usually the three man wears middle size, for this coat, small size are good fit. Thanks to the North Face for providing such a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: 11yearonamazon

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Jacket from II Model
customer_reviews.text: Although I liked the II style better so be it can't beat the warmth in March in NYC this jacket supplies.. Look to wear it all winter replacing the older model which a small hole formed on the inside so it lost some feathers..
customer_reviews.author: Keith Raulli

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: i bought this jacket for the cold winters in new york and it is amazing , many times you just need a good sweater and that is . If you live in new jersey you might need a sweater and a vest or only a sweater the sad part that i paid almost 230 dollars and it went on sale in north face for 180 But i dont have no regrets of purchasing this jackets
customer_reviews.author: bad

customer_reviews.author: gmt

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Bought to snow board with. Seems to be a solid jacket that keeps me warm. I am going to treat with water repellant as it is not best at repelling water after 1/2 day. Overall, I would buy it again.

customer_reviews.title: I love that the coat is fitted and it's not a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that the coat is fitted and it's not a puffy coat. It's great looking and most of all, it's the warmest coat ever! One little downside, the hood flops over your face when you have the fur collar on. Other than that, it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Roe P

customer_reviews.title: This jacket is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Midwest where the temperature is around 0 degrees F for a few weeks out of the year and this jacket preformed amazingly!

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof jacket with at least 5 secure pockets, hood, warm but not too thick and not crazy expensive. This was one of the very few that checked all the boxes. It's very warm, comfy and completely waterproof. The pockets are very secure with zippers and snaps and easily accessible. The only negative is the pockets are a little bit small (but not tiny).

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket
customer_reviews.text: I liked how it fits its warm and a nice fabric the problem is its expensive! Good brand

I have several TNF coats, most of which are size L. The Denali fleece coat I have is a L, among others. But this one fit much bigger. Even a M might be too large if I had to guess. Nonetheless, nice coat, wish the size was right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is better than I hoped it would be in bitter cold down into the teens and single digits when I zip it up completely and tighten the drawstrings. I'm very happy with it. It's also lightweight and not too bulky.

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves this jacket it’s very warm looks great I’d definitely buy another one in the future

customer_reviews.author: Darren Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The pockets are versatile and useful. The price is reasonable for what this jacket ...

customer_reviews.author: E.H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Men’s Coat, worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this coat. Seems very well made, varied layers, not as heavy as you’d imagine. And fits my husband true to size. For men that don’t care for the furry hood, it’s removable with snaps, done, bam 💥 problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Very warm jacket, runs a bit large
customer_reviews.text: I got the red color, it looks great. Ordered a size small which usually fits me well (I'm 5' 7" ~150 pounds) but this jacket runs a bit large, it's very puffy. It is also very warm, meant to be worn in below freezing temps. Overall, I like it a lot just a bit big for me.
customer_reviews.author: JFolt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality, buy a size smaller than normal
customer_reviews.text: Buy a size smaller than your regular size. I'm usually a medium (5"9', 140 lbs) and I bought a small and it's just right, still roomy enough to wear some extra layers underneath. The built in balaclava in the hood is a great idea. The length of the jacket is a little unusual, it's longer than a classic bomber jacket but shorter than a parka. Quality is top notch and it's very warm and snug. Another nice feature - I bought the navy jacket and all the branding is blacked out, very stealth and understated.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dollars

customer_reviews.title: A little short in the sleeves but overall an excellent coat
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 36/37 in shirts for my arm length and it just comes up to my wrist. If I had to do it over again I would have gotten an extra large. Overall excellent coat especially for the cold.

customer_reviews.title: Great JACKET

Overall is a great jacket, the red color is amazing , is WARM for the 30's only using a shirt under, not sure for the 20's. The sleeves are little baggy but is ok, is comfortable.. and like mensured before: get a size under.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, Big Bang for your buck!

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Jacket I’ve Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Great, liberal fit. Cuts the wind right off. Bottom stays snug against the top of hips. Snap pockets easy to open/close. Zipper closure wide enough to cover half my face. Faux fur snap-on at hood seems like a gimmick...until you use it. Some said it was heavy, and it is a bit, but not overly so. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ball Hunter

customer_reviews.title: No Elastic Tightening Band - Warm and Cold Simultaneously
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is warm but the sizing is off. The arm length/jacket width ratio is what you’d expect for someone who is built like a rectangle. Normally this wouldn’t be a problem if the jacket had an elastic waistband to tighten it and keep air out but it doesn’t, so unless you’ve got something filling the space between your shirt and the jacket, you finna be cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Jacket who is attending school in Baltimore were the winters are cold and very wet. He loves the jacket, he tells me that it keeps him warm and dry.

If you don't care for fit, I will say it was comfortable though I'm not a huge fan of the fur hood when it's up.

product_meta.title: The North Face Men's Gotham Jacket III
feature_bullets: DRY AND INSULATED. Made with a DryVent shell, this jacket features sealed seams and allows water vapor to escape for breathability. Goose down is certified to the Responsible Down Standard (RDS) by Control Union.
CONVERTIBLE DESIGN. A attached, fully adjustable hood with a removable faux-fur trim allows you to customize your look.
FOR CITY COLD. Don't let the cold stop you from exploring the streets. Inset rib-knit cuffs for and a rib-knit hem help block additional wind during your commute to and from work.

ON-THE-GO STORAGE. This jacket provides ample storage for all of your essentials. Patch pockets can be found along the chest and left bicep. Covered zip patch hand pockets provide secure storage and an internal zip media-compatible pocket holds your phone.
QUALITY CONSTRUCTION. A storm flap with snap closure covers the VISLON center front zip. The center front zip is durable and offers custom coverage depending on the weather.
